Question 64) Some indigenous peoples still preserve their traditions by fishing with spears, demonstrating a remarkable skill. To hook a fish in a lake with quiet waters the Indian must aim below the position in which he sees the fish.
He must proceed in this way because the rays of light
A) Reflected by the fish do not describe a rectilinear trajectory inside the water.
B) emitted through the eyes of the Indian deviate their trajectory when they pass from air to water.
C) scattered throughout the fish are reflected through the surface of the water.
D) emitted through the eyes of the Indian are scattered through the surface of the water.
E) reflected by the fish deflect their trajectory when they pass from water to air.
